Comment 8: 
I was meaning standard compiler Node constructs. See how recover is called:

n = mkcall("recover", n->type, init, nod(OADDR, nodfp, N));

You could pass &FP to racefuncenter and use pointer arithmetic in the runtime to get the
return address. You could also use directly -widthptr(FP) by cloning nodfp and setting
xoffset to -widthptr, I guess.
